text: Joseph Louis Bruno (April 8, 1929 – October 6, 2020) was an American businessman and Republican politician. He was born in Glens Falls, New York. From 1977 to 2008, he was a member of the New York State Senate. Between March to June 2008, he was Acting Lieutenant Governor of New York. In January 2009, Bruno was indicted on eight federal corruption charges, including mail and wire fraud.Britt Godshalk, YNN, Bruno Facing Corruption Charges , January 24, 2009 In December 2009, Bruno was convicted of two counts of mail and wire fraud. In May 2010, he was sentenced to two years in jail.Newspaper article, 2 Years for Bruno, by Brendan J. Lyons, Albany Times-Union, May 7, 2010Newspaper article, Former Senate Majority Leader Joseph Bruno convicted on 2 of 8 felony federal corruption counts , by Glenn Blain and Kenneth Lovett, New York Daily News, December 7, 2009 In May 2014, he was acquitted of all crimes.Lovett, Ken (May 16, 2014). State Sen. Joseph Bruno walks in corruption trial. New York Daily News. Retrieved June 2, 2014. Bruno died on October 6, 2020 at his home in Brunswick, New York from prostate cancer at the age of 91.Joseph L.
